catalog_info.title: Czech Literary Culture after World War II: Conference Course
catalog_info.notes: All readings in English. A separate weekly section for students with advanced reading knowledge of Czech will consider poetry and prose in the original.
catalog_info.description: Czech literature and film from the Nazi occupation through the Communist period to the Velvet Revolution, with a focus on Hrabal, Havel, and Kundera, as well as directors of the Czech New Wave, including Forman and NÄmec. We will pay special attention to intersections of politics and literature, including censorship, samizdat, and forms of underground culture and dissent.
